transportAdvice: Washington D.C. has an extensive metro rail and bus network that connects most major tourist attractions, making it easy to get around without a car. The National Mall and many monuments are within comfortable walking distance of each other, and taxis as well as rideshare vehicles are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold winter month with occasional snow or freezing rain and grey skies.
Still cold with a chance of snow, though brief mild spells can occur.
Early spring brings warming temperatures and the famous cherry blossoms toward month's end.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees and comfortable temperatures for sightseeing.
Warm and largely sunny, one of the best months to visit before summer heat sets in.
Hot and increasingly humid with occasional afternoon thunderstorms.
Peak summer heat and humidity make outdoor sightseeing uncomfortable during midday.
Remains hot and muggy with frequent afternoon thunderstorms and large tourist crowds.
Heat begins to ease and humidity drops, making for more comfortable outdoor exploration.
Crisp and sunny autumn weather with colorful foliage and ideal sightseeing conditions.
Cooling temperatures and shorter days signal the approach of winter, with occasional rain.
Cold and festive with holiday decorations throughout the city and a chance of snow.
